Description: Head of gypsum alabaster figure of youth (kouros) with archiac features and hair style. Hair rendered in thick plastic tresses, three horizontal across head, the rest vertical, falling down back, with the central parting indicated only slightly in the hairline above the forehead. Black patch on hair just below left ear may be paint. Possible traces of red paint in groove lips and on thin band atop forehead. Nose and chin chipped, damage also on top and at back of head. Head fragment, broken at neck from a figure.
Curator's comments: A number of alabaster kouros figures have been discovered at Naukratis. Parallels from Naukratis with a similar rendering of facial features, as well as the ears and hair have been dated 580BC-550BC ( Dundee, McManus Galleries 1975-137; see also Mercer Art Gallery, Harrogate Museums & Arts HARGM10393, but different hair arrangment). A closer parallel for the facial features, but with more detailed hair and finer work, has been dated 570BC-560BC (Moscow, Pushkin Museum of Fine Arts I 1a.3000). Torsos of similar alabaster figures from Naukratis have been dated 575BC-550BC (Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 88.734; British Museum GR 1886,0401.1384).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CD.111) (Phase 3)
